review_text: Beautiful, private and close to some great hikes!

The place was absolutely gorgeous and the view of the mountains was stunning!! Having the pool and hot tub made the experience amazing too!!! We absolutely loved the place and would definitely stay here again! Thank you for hosting us!
Amazing house, very clean and beautiful.
Beautiful place! Very peaceful and comfortable
This is a very private location. Beautiful scenery. Heated pool and hot tub were amazing. Me and the wife enjoyed our week here. We can‚Äôt wait to stay again!

We had a quiet few days with our kiddos here. It was everything we had hoped for! The views are unbeatable, the stars at night were so gorgeous, and we were so comfortable. Loved the hot tub and spa pool! And the kitchen had everything we needed to cook!
Our time was beautiful in this little sanctuary. The quietness reset us and gave us exactly what we needed for a couples weekend away. We hope to return someday soon. Thank you.
Overall great location and hosts. Will be returning.

It's always so nice when the place you're visiting is even nicer than the pictures can capture. We arrived after sunset so we didn't get a chance to take in all the amazing nature around us until the next morning, but as we entered the home we both let out a sigh or relief and relaxation. We loved the layout of the home and it was the perfect size for our little weekend getaway. Once the sun came up the next morning we were treated to some of the best views through the large windows that span the living room area. This one is going on the list of favorites for sure.

Absolutely beautiful house with great views and privacy. The hot tub and swim spa were fantastic and relaxing. The house was spotless and host communication was great. This is a fabulous place to stay!

The home had everything we needed and was clean and just as described... We felt right at home immediately. The surroundings are absolutely beautiful and so peaceful. Perfect place to spend our anniversary and we already want to go back! Would absolutely recommend it to anyone!!!!!
Excellent place! Secluded and quiet. Well hosted with all details considered. Hope to stay there again!
This was one of my favorite Airbnbs that we have stayed in! We loved the mountain view from the beautiful back deck. It was very clean, organized, and cozy. Would love to stay again!
Went here for our honeymoon and Place was out of this world will be recommending to anyone and everyone.

What a beautiful place to stay! The swim spa and hot tub, the horseshoes and firepit, the walking trails and beautiful view from the deck all made this a peaceful and relaxing place to stay. The architecture and decor were well done and made it feel luxurious.

What a beautiful peaceful place to get away, soaking in the heated pool or spa and watching the night go by. Take a day trip to Chattanooga to visit the Aquarium, See Rock City, and Ruby Falls. Great. If you want great BBQ, travel to LaFayette and see the Wardlaw family at Lucky Eye Q, you won't be disappointed, leave room for some homemade Banna Pudding. The house has all the amenities needed for a restful stay.

Second stay at Pinhoti for us. Always have enjoyed this location. The place was as described, very clean and very private. Enjoyed the deck, especially late at night to watch the Perseids meteor shower this year. This was a perfect setting for it, away from light pollution.

My wife and I had such a wonderful time staying at Pinhoti! It is exactly what we were looking for when searching for a place to celebrate our anniversary. It was private, peaceful, and had all the accommodations of home. Alisa is a fantastic host as well! We have zero complaints!
Amazing stay! Will be back!

We loved staying here! We booked this home for our 15th anniversary, and we wanted something secluded but nice. This place for the bill!
We were a little worried about how far away restaurants would be, but LaFayette was about 15 minutes away, so that wasn‚Äôt a bad drive at all.
The beds are modern and low, and might be difficult for older people to get out of. The early morning sun also comes in the large windows, so if you‚Äôre looking to sleep in, that might be difficult.
Over all, this house made for a great trip, and we would definitely recommend.
We enjoyed this beautiful home with great views and tons of privacy!
Great cabin if you're looking to be close to Jarrod's Place.

The house is nice but i found that wasn‚Äôt as clean as suppose to be considering the extremely high fees from evolve managing the property
The outside grill was very dirty and imposible to use
Pots and pans were old and some cutlery found in dishwasher were dirty, not big deal but again evolve charge very high managing fees plus the airbnb fees so i was expecting a sparkle house
The location is secluded if you looking for a peaceful lonely time this is the place to be
But bring food , and all u need to spend your days here
Restaurants are not near by and the closest supermarket is 15/20 min away
If you don‚Äôt like dogs, just be careful w the neighbor friendly big dog because he will jump on you and get into the house w no problem
Wifi is good, house is ample and the outside is green and peaceful , we loved to seat under the outside cabana and rest in the hammock
Great stay for our group .
Our stay was perfect!
Cant wait to come back!
This was such a great weekend stay. The setting is calm, the cabin is clean, and communication is spot-on. Overall fantastic!
Very comfy, clean and comforting! Great location, really beautiful surroundings! Definitely planning on staying again!

We had an absolutely wonderful time at this gem we found. We were looking for a place to stay while our kids were at Berry College for a camp. We loved the quiet, peaceful location where we could relax, grill, walk near the stream, and have a glass of wine while watching the fireflies. We were close enough to Rome to get a good bite to eat and took two day trips to Chattanooga to go to Rock City and Ruby Falls. The inside was very clean with many pieces of furniture and decor and with hand crafted wood. We would stay here again for sure if in the area!
the house was nice and clean. located in a quiet area with nice views. we enjoyed our stay.
Beautiful place! Friendly and helpful contact person!

We stopped here for 2 days on our way to Florida and were glad for the relaxing setting to unwind. The space was beautiful and roomy enough for 2 teens, 2 tweens in the loft, and mom and dad in the master. Being able to bring our 2 small dogs was a bonus, and we made friends with the dog next door who was super friendly. The front porch was peaceful in the morning for coffee, and the fire pit was perfect for smores with gathered sticks we found on the grounds. We ordered door dash one night and went to eat at The Willow Tree the second night where we had great service and food. We had everything we needed and definitely recommend.

We came up from Atlanta spending a few days in Rome with friends and family. This spot was awesome! 22 ish min drive from Rome, but secluded and had everything you need for a fun night in. Bon fire, corn hole, seats with a view for morning coffee.
The 2 twin beds are up a ladder that leads to the loft. Super cute.
Loved that it was dog friendly.
It was perfect for us. Thanks!
it was very nice and quiet.
Nice cabin In a great spot!
We really enjoyed our stay. The house was very clean and well maintained. The host was awesome in reaching out and checking in to make sure everything was good. We would definitely stay again.
Great place to stay
Honeymoon weekend before we leave to go on our actual honeymoon, we will visit again
A great secluded and clean place that is a nice getaway from the city. It was relaxing to use the fire pit at night and hear the water from the stream nearby.

Wonderful stay! Just what we needed. Rented for my husband, myself, and my parents to celebrate a family wedding at Burke Farm. Great location, clean and modern stay. Easy check in. We REALLY enjoyed the covered porch. Thanks again!
Very peaceful location and lovely stay!
Great stay!
Great cabin. Extremely quiet area, but close by everything we needed.

My family had a great stay here! This beautiful cabin is tucked away and not in the middle of town but still within driving distance to local attractions. Highly recommend and we will definitely be back!
This was a cute place and perfect for our group. We really enjoyed our stay!
place was great, very chill and quaint. thanks for a great stay!
Our stay was wonderful. The space was exactly as described. The only thing that could have been better was the check-out time.
The cutest little house in the most tranquil area. Perfect for a family or friends trip. An escape away from everything and the house has everything you need. Will definitely be back!!
Very clean, well stocked on dishes, towels and wash clothes. Covered back porch was amazing!
Very nice place, everything is well done.
Wonderful stay!!
Thanks for the experience see you soon !!
This place is beautiful, peaceful, and clean! We loved every minute of our stay. There are also so many beautiful sights to see nearby.

The property was nice and very clean. we slept 5 very comfortably. The parking is on gravel up a hill so we did have to maneuver our cars a bit to get in and out. But we enjoyed our stay and had no issues. A few questions were answered very quickly. We would stay here again.

If you are looking for a great home away from home this is the place. This is not my first experience in an AirBNB this my first time in a cabin. We honestly enjoyed the peace and Serenity. Thank you again for such a beautiful home
We had a wonderful and relaxing quiet stay. The property is very clean and has everything you need! We will definitely visit again.

Beautifully decorated, cute place. We had suv & could maneuver driveway ok but small car might have problems, very washed out.
We recommend bringing paper plates, since only 4 plates & 4 bowls are stocked there currently.
Loved the outdoor covered deck & pictures don‚Äôt show but there is comfortable seating (couch & chairs) out on it as well which was nice along with a little table & 2 chairs.
(Only down was neighbors close & one has a dog that yelps all day long, can‚Äôt hear inside but if you want to enjoy outside area bring ear plugs or music to drown out the yelping)
I cannot rave about this place enough. Everything was so thought out amenity wise. This place is the PERFECT spot for a little getaway. We cannot wait to come back.
If you are visiting students at Berry College it is a much better place to stay and only 13 miles from the school.
This is an amazing place to have a getaway if you want to relax and enjoy some peace and tranquility. The host is amazing and the property is spectacular. I will definitely return to this property.
Thank you for your kindness! We enjoyed our beautiful stay! Melissa, Emily, & Lisa

Quaint and comfortable little house with a ‚Äúlittle house on the prairie‚Äù vibe. Modern amenities without modern distractions, (i.e. tv‚Äôs). Beds were comfortable. House was fully stocked with necessities in bathrooms and kitchens. Farm was enjoyable and peaceful with several farm animals that were safely contained in enclosures for viewing and petting. It is a short drive to the city but that is to be expected with the country charm of the home and its location.

The farm is fun and relaxed and interactive and calm and everything you could want or expect from a mountain farm. It is child-friendly - including the animals - and is a great place for families to explore and roam. The location is wonderful, nestled nicely between several mountain communities. It‚Äôs a rural location and a rural atmosphere at the farm. We loved it.

Joseph's place actually looked better than the photos(!) and was more beautiful, serene, and "homey" than I expected. I brought three older family members who'd never been at an Airbnb before and they were blown away by the home, the animals, the entire property. Their standards are quite high now! :)
Yummy, family-owned restaurants are nearby. Finster's Paradise Gardens and Little River Canyon National Park - must sees! - are also close. And the locals, including Joseph, are so helpful, friendly, and easy-going. All around great experience!
We loved our stay! The farm was beautiful and the animals were the sweetest. Our kids loved playing on the playground and fishing. We would definitely recommend staying here!

This was the most amazing weekend get away we could have asked for. From the friendly host, the most relaxing surroundings, the ability to move about freely, and the accessibility to local stores was feasible. We enjoyed the attractions that were close at hand. And the views were so amazing!
Joseph was friendly and accommodating. He gave us the ground rules for access to his animals (i.e. close gates behind us) and gave us free reign of move on his property to enjoy our visit and explore at our leisure. He offered to let our girls help him feed his animals and let them fish from his pond until their hearts were content.
We would love to visit again, just to enjoy another vacation and visit the places we didn't get to see before.

My family of 4 loved this place. Our East coast teens fell in love with all of the farm animals. The animals are so cute and friendly. The rental is so unique and was such a fun farm experience. The beds are really comfortable. The kitchen had everything we needed. We did bring our own coffee grounds and creamer, so I am not sure if that is stocked. Bathroom/Shower was great. The weather was cold and gloomy, but the scenery was beautiful and the rental was plenty warm enough. We hope to come back again.

Enjoyed the weekend using the Orchard as our landing spot. The kitchen is wonderfully stocked--which we value when we traveling so we can still have quiet, home cooked meals. What is also really great, and unlike most other Air BnBs, is that I didn't have to worry about sending the kids out to play since this is not in a city/neighborhood/ etc and so therefore you are not restricted to just the house space. There is a double play structure, space to play ball, animals to observe. We would consider coming again.

Very friendly place and fun
Joseph farm is a great place for a family

Wonderful experience! Me and a group of buddies came down to ride at Jarrod‚Äôs place and having a spot that was super peaceful and only 35 minutes away was wonderful. Peaceful and quiet!
Felt right at home. Cozy place with beautiful setting.
Loved our stay !!! Sneaky was a family favorite as well as the dog that hung out with us during our stay ! Will definitely stay again as well as recommend to others ! All around amazing stay !
Very cute place, cottage feel. The grandkids loved the playground area and animals. Very quiet and relaxing. Joseph was always very responsive and made sure we had everything we needed!

The farm was very entertaining for the kids. Lots of animals for them to pet and feed. I liked that we had no T.Vs so we got a chance to unplug. Host left us dinner which we loved. This is a definite working farm with old farm charm.

My husband and I had a wonderful weekend. It was peaceful and quiet. Getting to pet the alpacas, the sheep, the goat, and the dogs was a bonus! The space was very private and serene. We were celebrating our 27th wedding anniversary and this place was perfect. Lazy days of laying about reading and wandering around the farm.
We also drove into Summerville and visited Howard Finster's Paradise Garden. We also bought several EXCELLENT ribeye steaks at Lucky's Grocery in Menlo.
Thanks for the hospitality.

We really enjoyed our stay at Joseph's place. It is out in the country but less than 20 minutes from the attractions of Little River Canyon National Preserve, Mentone, and Desoto State Park. The house is really tastefully done, the kitchen is great, and the added fun of the alpacas was so great! Joseph was responsive and helpful. Highly recommended!

We stayed at several Airbnbs during our cross-country move, and Orchard Farms was far and away our favorite. The kids loved the animals, and the house was beautiful. Joseph even messaged us to offer an earlier check-in and made sure the temperature was comfortable before we got there. We would definitely stay again. Thanks again for a fantastic stay.
We enjoyed our stay. We felt very welcomed. It was so beautiful, peaceful, and quiet. Joseph was so nice to talk with us about the farm. We loved visiting with the animals.

We have stayed in a lot of places, and Joseph was by far the kindest, most responsive host we have ever had. He went above and beyond to make my family feel at home from tips and help with fishing to letting my children help feed the new baby alpaca. The house was super cute, and we adored the feel of the old farm house style. We would recommend this stay to anyone!

This place was awesome and I certainly want to come back for a longer stay. The baby alpaca on the property was the cutest thing I've ever seen and we got free range to walk around and see and pet the animals. The house is so cute and clean. The ac worked great even in 100 degree heat. Would 100% recommend!

This was just what my family needed. Our girls loved the alpacas, the goats, the dogs, the trails, everything. If you are looking for a farm experience, this is the place for you. Make sure you know what you are asking for, because this was genuinely country. We appreciated the local knowledge, the homemade jams and sauces, the friendliness of Joseph and Angie. We would definitely visit again if the chance presents itself.
One of my favorite stays. Great for families

Loved it! Stayed for one night while traveling, wish we had a chance to stay longer. The cabin was wonderful, and the farm with the cutest friendly animals was just so charming!
We got in later than we expected, and the key was exactly where Joseph said we would find it. It was easy to get into the cabin, and he had left several lights on for us.
Between the master bedroom downstairs, and the huge upstairs sleeping area with three different comfy beds, you could sleep seven people here easily. If you have mobility issues, it‚Äôs steep narrow stairs to the 2nd floor. Bathroom had modern fixtures.
Downstairs there‚Äôs a cute sitting area and a great kitchen - the double oven was impressive! There‚Äôs a coffee maker.
The area is very private, just us and the sweet dog, goats and alpacas who wanted pets.
If you are a barefoot family like us, we did find a few dead bugs that snuck in - a wasp on the floor upstairs and a couple sharp staples in the wood so you might want to wear shoes.
Great place to stay.
We had a great weekend. Thank you so much Joseph. We will definitely be back.

This was a lovely place to stay! The kids were totally taken in by the friendly animals are thrilled to spend time with them. The setting is a farm, so by nature it's not completely 'clean'. However, for an old farmhouse, it felt fine. We would happily stay here again!
Oh, and for these Westerners, the fireflies were a great attraction. :)

The interior was done in very nice farm decor and the beds were comfortable. The setting was outstanding. ..so beautiful and rural. But, we were taken aback by an old stained toilet setting outside on the deck, popped dangerous nails on the deck and rusted table and chairs. The place was so nice and so peaceful. Seeing the horse, goats and dogs proved delightful, but sitting on an unkempt deck with our coffee was disappointing. Once he gives some attention to the deck and removes the toilet, I would happily give the stay a 5 star. Please also remove the metal farm implement on the floor. Someone can trip going to the bathroom during the night and be seriously hurt.

We had the best time and look forward to visiting again! Joseph was very welcoming, very responsive, and included our son in feeding the animals. We enjoyed visiting the precious animals and their personalities. The pond was fun to fish in the mornings and evenings. We loved getting to disconnect and live the farm life for a few days and my son is already asking when we can visit again.

We stayed at the Orchard House while in Georgia for a wedding. We arrived VERY late in the evening and the host was very accommodating. There were plenty of kitchen amenities and the spaces were clean. We all loved walking around the farm and seeing the animals right out the window. The host took our 8 and 9 year olds to ride through so mud puddles and they had a blast. Definitely lots to do if you‚Äôre looking for a place to just hang out and enjoy the space.

Wow. This place is an absolute GEM. It‚Äôs so much better than the description! It‚Äôs a entire farmhouse nestled into the most incredible hobby farm. My kids absolutely loved all the animals and the full Playground. I wish we had been able to stay longer. 10/10 recommend

Beautiful little country home on a wonderful farm with lots of sweet animals to love on and admire. No TV so it‚Äôs perfect for a family getaway and time to reconnect. Would highly recommend and would definitely stay here again.

We had a wonderful stay at Orchard Farms with our family. It is a working farm and exactly what we wanted. Peaceful and private, yet easy to access. My family and I enjoyed a wonderful, unplugged getaway at Orchard farms! Recommend if you would enjoy some beautiful surroundings and peaceful unplugged time. Charming house .. fire pit, animals to visit with. Our family loved our time!
Place was great! Exactly as pictured! We had fresh farm eggs and herbs waiting for us! Shannon was gracious and responded quickly! My family wanted to stay longer! Thank you!

This was an absolutely fabulous experience. Steers Place has everything going for it and the host (Shannon) could not be more gracious, very pleasant and extremely accommodating.

I absolutely loved this place and Shannon!!!! It was very peaceful and just an amazing environment!! We will definitely come back and stay! We absolutely loved the cottage. What a wonderful place- very peaceful and easy to get in and out of. Would definitely stay again!
My friends and I loved this cute little space. Definitely will be back!

Very safe area in North Georgia.

The cottage was absolutely stunning in every way. Shannon did an amazing job and you can tell the heart and soul that was put into designing it and putting it together. Amazing cabin and Shannon was an amazing host, Will definitely be back!

Ready to get away from it all? GO HERE! This is the perfect place to unwind, enjoy nature, and soak up peace and tranquility. Also, you can bottle feed baby cows - how amazing is that?! I can't recommend this place enough and I can't thank Shannon enough for her wonderful hospitality!
An amazing little place, all the animals are so sweet and Shannon is a really great person and easy to get in touch with and really helpful. I would definitely come back
Had a wonderful time. Thank you Shannon.

This is one of my very favorite airbnbs! Shannon was very welcoming and there were so many personal and thoughtful touches, like farm fresh eggs and she provided a dog bed for our pup. The kitchen was fully furnished and had everything we needed. It was such a peaceful and serene area. We went on several gorgeous hikes on trails nearby. I would happily stay again next time I‚Äôm in the area.

Always great staying with you.
Would highly recommend.
Jafer's place is perfect for a get away. Peaceful and quiet. Beautiful scenery.
Adorable tiny home in a beautiful area!

This place was awesome! Quiet and super clean! beautiful scenery, quiet and peaceful. Jafer was great too. And he really went above and beyond to help us out on the way out. Will definitely book again when we‚Äôre in the area!
It was great quiet and very peaceful
We had a dream weekend disconnected from the outside world, a place with a lot of peace and tranquility to recharge, we will definitely return, it is a beautiful place!
never stayed in a tiny house before, good spot if traveling light, and we did. host was kind enough to provide guest's with nice essentials. thanks again.

Stayed for one night, had a phenomenal stay, wish I could keep this place secret, it‚Äôs a perfect spot to unplug and getaway
Absolutely peaceful, cozy, accessible location. My friend and I had a wonderful time enjoying the simplicity and abundance of nature. Highly recommend ;) No Wi-fi was definitely a perk.

What a charming tiny home, great for two or three people depending on sleeping arrangements. All the notes around the place, the communication, the lovely setting and clean lodging made it a great stay. It‚Äôs dark, quiet and rural, unplug and enjoy.
Being so close to Jarrod‚Äôs Place, a mountain bike park, it‚Äôs super convenient for our needs.
Thank you so much, we hope to come back again soon!
Please was nice and convenient for a weekend away
We loved the tiny home! A great little spot to unwind and enjoy the scenery!

Jafer and Chanel always responded super quickly and the accommodation was impeccable, very clean and cozy, we loved it, it was a very pleasant stay, I really recommend the place to disconnect from the world.

A TINY HOME full of peace and contentment. I throughly enjoyed my coffee time with the birds and squirrels and the sounds of nature. Thank you to our hosts for truly caring about our stay, and for being flexible when our arrival time changed unexpectedly. It was a simple delight in the middle of the woods!
Very peaceful stay. The tiny house was very clean and inviting. If you want a private peaceful place to stay, this is definitely it!
Loved staying here! Everything is beautiful, clean, and we enjoyed getting away from the busy city for a while.

We absolutely love this place! Yes, it's out in the middle of nowhere but that was the point! Just the right size for holiday trip.

I highly recommend this place, especially if you're seeking an escape from your hectic daily routine. With no wifi or phone service, it's the perfect spot to unwind and recharge. Plus, they offer all the essential amenities and more!

10/10 would recommend this place, especially if you‚Äôre wanting to get away from your busy day to day life. There is no wifi or phone service which makes it a perfect place to disconnect and reset.
They have all the amenities you would need and then some!
Jeff and Chanel were very helpful and professional and the tiny home was lovely.
Our stay was fantastic. The host was extremely accommodating and the cabin was so cute. We loved being off the grid and it was super close to our favorite bike park. We will definitely be back!

OMG!!! This was the best weekend off the grid literally! My husband and I needed a quick quiet getaway. This was more than we expected. The host were extremely helpful and responsive. First off: Paradise Garden is once again a work in progress. By the time Howard Finster passed about 20 years ago, the grounds had started to fall into disrepair, a process which accelerated for about a decade or so before folks came in to restore it back to something resembling his original vision. Some places are off limits to the public for safety purposes, and there's construction equipment on site to further the work.
There's also a relative paucity of the famous Finster art on the grounds for reasons that are pretty complicated, but there's a representative display in the visitor's center.
The actual site represents decades of work by Finster and various family, friends, helpers, and etc. to convert a piece of soggy marshy land into a wonderland of plant life, color, and texture. Even without the big paintings of Elvis it's a remarkable place to visit, and I couldn't help but think how it would have been just the coolest place in the world to play as a little kid. It's wonderful, it's whimsical, and it's steeped in a specific kind of Southern charm.
Which brings us to the actual AirBNB space, which is half of a shotgun-style duplex. First things first - it's definitely cozy. There's a front room with a bar sink, a mini fridge, and a microwave, plus some armchairs and a comfy sofa. The bedroom is in back and has a large and very pleasant bed and a few more armchairs. There's a bathroom in between.
It's decorated in an eclectic and charming style, with bright colors on the walls, folk art (including some Finster replicas) everywhere, and some lovely older furniture that calls back to when this was someone's actual home. The neighborhood is still very much a working-class one, and the homes reflect that. This was a simple home for common folks, and that energy permeates the space. It felt like the kind of house my parents or grandparents might have lived in, once.
There are two lovely cats that roam the grounds and hang out on the porch. They're your buddies and would love nothing more than to slink around your ankles as you sit in the porch swing.
There is one caveat - it's an older house, it's a duplex, and you do share a wall with the other unit. You can hear them if they get a little loud, and they can hear you. That being said, we didn't care and thankfully, neither did our neighbors!
It's worth the trek, but be advised that Summerville really is "out there" insofar as the comforts and amenities of the city. There are some mom and pop restaurants and some national fast food chains, but don't come here expecting to find, say, boutique shopping or exotic restaurants or hip nightclubs or whatever - just a slice of a vanishing South that's worth enjoying on its own merits.
